title: Intel's future computers have two screens
description: Intel doesn't make computers, but that doesn't mean the company doesn't build prototypes of them. When Intel thinks of new ways their chips can be used, they build prototypes to prove it's possible, then partner with device makers to turn it into a consumer product. A recent example is Lenovo's new Yoga Book C930, which is based on Intel's Tiger Rapids prototype. In this week's Processor episode, Dieter  Bohn visited Intel's Client Experience Center to learn why they build technologies for the future of computing just to give them away.
